div.p: No Archean land endmember scenario. Panels Aâ€“ F, lines, and, shadings are the same as in Fig. 3. ( E) Continental weathering drops to zero in the Archean, but ( F) seafloor weathering increases due to its temperature dependence to balance the carbon cycle. This causes an increase in surface temperature in the Archean, ( D) but conditions are still temperate throughout Earth history. The evolution of ( A) ocean pH and ( B) pCO 2 are similar to the nominal model. dep, deposit.
